title: burugcrypto
author: burugcrypto
content: I guess there should be a separate category for posting memes.  Lot of categories spread with scammers, spammers and trolling. Few categories gives knowledge and healthy discussions. But there is no place for fun. @theymos  , Please start a separate category for posting memes. All those who want this category, Please vouch this post.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Mbitr on October 07, 2022, 02:18:32 PMhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5232907.340Threads like this one are best for memes, not necessarily separate subsections. With most memes, they're just for quick laughs and there's really nothing much to discuss (hence making separate threads mostly useless).

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: Quote from: burugcrypto on October 07, 2022, 02:15:22 PMI guess there should be a separate category for posting memes.  Lot of categories spread with scammers, spammers and trolling. Few categories gives knowledge and healthy discussions. But there is no place for fun. @theymos  , Please start a separate category for posting memes. All those who want this category, Please vouch this post. I think this topic is more suitable for Meta since this is about the forum discussion. And also most of the meme posted in the forum is on the Bitcoin WO or on off topic since moderator will count a single meme post spam if it was made on other topic besides off-topic or WO(or other board which no one cares about post quality) when user report it as spam. Paid post abused by shit poster is what makes the forum forced to removed memes or humor post on a discussion topic since this doesn’t add value on the discussion.I believe this Meme category will be a good addition to the forum as lounge for user that want some light and funny discussion.

comments.author: isaac_clarke22
comments.body: Quote from: burugcrypto on October 07, 2022, 02:15:22 PM~Adding to what mk4 and Mbitr mentioned, if you're going to make meme post as an icebreaker with a quite discussion running, you can just do it as it is in Bitcoin Discussion board, just add more content to the post if you can for a little bit of.....context. Altcoins go to their respective board (Altcoin Discussion). If it is non-crypto related meme, just do it in Off-Topic board. We do not need a "Meme" sub-board.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: Memes are fun when used sparingly. A whole section would just encourage low level of spam, and lets be honest not many users would use it. Bitcoin only has a limited amount of memes anyhow. I think Reddit would be a better place for that type of content, as the way it displays posts suits it. Not necessarily a subreddit dedicated to Bitcoin, though. Maybe, a more meme centric sub reddit or maybe Twitter. I'd say with a high level of certainty you won't be seeing a section dedicated to memes any time soon. This forum is primarily a discussion based forum.

comments.author: PowerGlove
comments.body: Like Welsh said, a dedicated section just for memes would be taken as encouragement to post them, and it'll likely turn into a dumping ground for low-quality posts pretty quickly.As a new user [1], OP can be forgiven for thinking that there's no appropriate place to be a goofball on Bitcointalk; that was my impression too, when I joined.As mentioned above, there are already a few places on the forum where silliness is appreciated, and I'm sure OP will discover them over time (WO, etc.)For some reason, I don't find Bitcoin memes nearly as funny as Bitcointalk memes; n0nce pointed out this one, which got me pretty good! [1] Account is from 2020, but posting only really began 2 days ago.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: I can't remember in which crypto forum (altcointalk may or something like that) I have seen a few hundred of boards lol and the feeling when I browsed the forum was horrible. I didn't anymore go to that forum. Do you want to have the same forum? With all these boards, the forum will be much crowding that a lot of people will have horrible feelings while visiting the forum. Right now, there are only a few boards necessary. LN board is one of them and I think that should be the priority.

comments.author: PrimeNumber7
comments.body: I think that posting memes much of the time will be against the rules, specifically the rule against posting no/low value posts. This is a discussion forum. As such, posts should be part of a discussion.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I'd like to think that when it comes to an appropriate meme, no category is off limits.  Surely we've all seen memes used throughout this forum without people getting upset about it.  I myself am even guilty of using memes to poke fun at certain situations and users when ridiculousness ensues.  So I don't believe a meme category is necessary.  Just consider no category safe from memes and you'll be fine.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: burugcrypto on October 07, 2022, 02:15:22 PMI guess there should be a separate category for posting memes. A whole section?  There's that one thread Mbitr mentioned, and I think that's more than sufficient.  I hate to say this, but it's almost like you're asking for there to be a kiddie's section of bitcointalk where finger paintings can be displayed, and if Theymos has ignored all the other requests for new section additions (NFTs, for example), there's no way in hell he'd go for this one.Memes have their place, of course, but you're the first member I can recall who's ever suggested them having any sort of space on the forum dedicated to them.  Ick.
